p: There were 74 indicators monitored across the different programmes, with the number of indicators/categories monitored by each programme varied. SmartIce monitored the smallest number of indicators, exclusively monitoring sea-ice thickness, while the LEO Network monitored the greatest number, allowing participants to record observations related to approximately 24 different categories of environment/human change. The mean number of indicators collected was nine while the majority of programmes (n = 13) monitored five or fewer indicators/categories.
